snippet: A new book shows how digital technology in casino gambling can fan players’ hope of success — and keep them in front of the screen.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column highlights book Addiction by Design: Machine Gambling in Las Vegas by Natasha Dow Schull, which describes how shift in casino gambling to screen-based games contributes to gambling addiction; points out addiction specialists are concerned that near-wins and false wins served up by digital slot machines set off same reward mechanism in brain that is activated by actually winning a game.
lead_paragraph: A new book shows how digital technology in casino gambling can fan players’ hope of success — and keep them in front of the screen.

headline.seo: How Slot Machines Raise Our Hopes, Even When We’re Losing
headline.main: I’m Losing Money. So Why Do I Feel So Good?
